meanings.definition: To make something traditional or conform to tradition.
meanings.sent1: She is traditionalizing the family recipe by using only organic ingredients.
meanings.sent2: The community is traditionalizing the annual festival by including cultural dances.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally spilled the sauce while traditionalizing the dish, creating a messy situation.
meanings.sent4: By traditionalizing the ceremony, they hoped to honor their ancestors in a meaningful way.
meanings.sent5: The artist is traditionalizing a modern painting style to pay homage to classical art forms.

meanings.definition: The act of following or adhering to tradition.
meanings.sent1: Her traditionalizing of family customs brought a sense of unity to the household.
meanings.sent2: The traditionalizing of the ceremony highlighted the importance of cultural heritage.
meanings.sent3: The traditionalizing of the school dress code led to some humorous fashion choices.
meanings.sent4: His traditionalizing of storytelling captivated the audience with its timeless charm.
meanings.sent5: The traditionalizing of the recipe preserved the flavors of generations past.
